#summary Console command: clusters
#labels console

= Clusters =

Display all the clusters configured in the current database.

== Syntax ==

{{{clusters}}}

== Example ==

{{{
> clusters

CLUSTERS:
--------------------+------+--------------------+-----------+
NAME                |  ID  | TYPE               | ELEMENTS  |
--------------------+------+--------------------+-----------+
metadata            |     0|Physical            |        11 |
index               |     1|Physical            |         0 |
default             |     2|Physical            |       779 |
csv                 |     3|Physical            |      1000 |
binary              |     4|Physical            |      1001 |
person              |     5|Physical            |         7 |
animal              |     6|Physical            |         5 |
animalrace          |    -2|Logical             |         0 |
animaltype          |    -3|Logical             |         1 |
orderitem           |    -4|Logical             |         0 |
order               |    -5|Logical             |         0 |
city                |    -6|Logical             |         3 |
--------------------+------+--------------------+-----------+
TOTAL                                                  2807 |
------------------------------------------------------------+
}}}

== See also ==

To create a new cluster in the current database use the command [ConsoleCommandCreateCluster create cluster].

This is a command of the Orient console. To know all the commands go to [ConsoleCommands Console commands].
